thread.title: Victoria Beckham flashes a rare smile as she stocks up for Storm Stella
thread.title_full: Victoria Beckham flashes a rare smile as she stocks up for Storm Stella

author: Helena Horton
title: Victoria Beckham flashes a rare smile as she stocks up for Storm Stella
text:
Victoria Beckham flashes a rare smile as she stocks up for Storm Stella Victoria Beckham grinned as she stocked up on groceries Credit: Jackson Lee / Splash News 14 March 2017 â€¢ 9:15am 
V ictoria Beckham is known for her pout, and the fact she hates smiling in photographs. 
However, this didn't stop her from grinning as she made her way around a supermarket while shopping in preparation for Storm Stella. 
The singer-turned-fashion-designer chose to shop at Whole Foods, where she bought some healthy groceries before preparing to hunker down and wait out the storm. 
She snacked on sushi before walking down the aisles to select her food, and wore her trademark black sunglasses even indoors. A post shared by Victoria Beckham (@victoriabeckham) on Nov 10, 2016 at 3:49am PST 
M rs Beckham bought a large pack of smoked salmon, crunchy sprouts, blackberries, hummus, boxes of cereal, and some gourmet bread. 
The star did smile in public frequently while she was a Spice Girl, but in recent years has preferred to pout for the camera and almost never grins in public. 
She has spoken of this before, telling Vogue she never smiles because she feels she has "a responsibility to the fashion community". Watch | Winter storm Stella approaches US east coast 00:24 
O fficials have warned people in northeastern America not to go outside during the storm. 
"If you must go out, do so for as limited time period as possible ... but the best thing to do is stay in," New York Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Monday. 
Above-ground subway service will be suspended at 4 a.m. local time as transit officials in the New York metro area warned that more bus and train routes could be suspended throughout the day. 
"It's a good day to stay home," said New York Governor Andrew Cuomo on CBS Radio. "It is going to be a dangerous, dangerous situation." Follow Telegraph News
